arch:property.oc:show_val: Narrowing of the entrance to the colonnaded corridor north of the stairway
Opening elevation: East section 900.71 m; West section: 900.56 m.

Phase X: Site abandonment after major collapse dating to the Byzantine period from the CE 4th to 5th c. New drainage systems are installed including that associated with the newly built west precinct wall.
Closing elevation: East section: 899.82 m; West section: 899.69 m.
East section: 0.44 m north south -by- 0.60 m east west. West section: 0.51 m north south -by- 0.84 m east west.
East section: 0.89 m; West section: 0.87 m.
Post-363 reworking of the Complex, including blockage of doorways and the covering of the ornamental pool.

Locus 75 is the narrowing of the space between the two most western columns of the colonnade, located in front of the stairway (Locus 48). It consists of two large vertical hewn ashlars, as well as other smaller stones surrounding and supporting them. This locus is phased to Stage 4, the post-363 reworking of the Complex. This phasing is proposed because of the second period of blocking in which the entrance space left between the two ashlars with this locus is finally closed in. That later blockage is phased to Stage 5, and Locus 75 is then phased with the other intercolumnar walls to Stage 4.

oc:metadata.dc:title: Petra Great Temple Excavations: Locus 75 (Locus)
